alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 3:08PM MDT until June 12 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL MORA COUNTY... At 308 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.25 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... State Roads 271, 120, Horn Wengert Loop, Moures Ranch Road, and Carrizo Creek. This includes the following recreation areas... Mills Canyon Campground. This includes the following streams and drainages... Canadian River, Carrizo Creek, Ciruela Creek, Chorro, Arroyo, Sixtysix Creek, Puerto, Arroyo, Tata Vique, Vermejo Creek, Ensinosa, Ca√±ada, Beaver Creek, Piedra Lumbre, Arroyo and Alamosa Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely.
